content.title: Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS) for MSME Sector: Assistance of Fixed Capital Investment Subsidy
content.details: The scheme provides assistance in the form of fixed capital investment subsidy to MSMEs for their expansion and diversification activities.
benefits: Support for expansion and diversification activities
Eligibility for benefits even if the enterprise is sold within five years
eligibility: Existing or new enterprises making an investment exceeding 50% of GFCI
At least 60% of the investment must be in plant and machinery
exclusions: Secondhand machineries are not eligible for benefits under the scheme
content.application_process: Eligible units can apply by visiting the single window portal website 'swp.dddgov.in' and selecting the appropriate options.
documents_required: Affidavit containing details of subsidy received from GOI or any other agencies
Documentation proving eligibility and investment details

faqs.question: What happens to the benefit of the incentive if a newly setup enterprise is sold or transferred to a new owner within the first five years of its establishment?
faqs.answer: The benefit of the incentive shall be available to such transferee or the new owner, only for the unexpired portion.

faqs.question: What is the definition of Expansion/ Diversification?
faqs.answer: Expansion/Diversification means where an existing/New Enterprise increases its investment by at least 50% of its existing Gross Fixed capital investment.

faqs.question: What measures are in place to prevent misuse of the subsidy scheme?
faqs.answer: Strict guidelines, documentation requirements, and verification procedures are in place to ensure that subsidies are availed by eligible enterprises for genuine purposes only.

faqs.question: What is the operative period of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The operative period of the scheme is from 20.05.2022 till 19.05.2027.

faqs.question: If an enterprise is established in 2023 and becomes eligible for the scheme what would be the time period in which benefits are applicable?
faqs.answer: The enterprise can avail benefit commencing from date of production till 5 years even if that period falls beyond operative period.

faqs.question: What is the timeline of making an application?
faqs.answer: The timeline to make application is within one year of first disbursement of loan or within one year of production whichever is later.

faqs.question: What is meant by Gross Fixed Capital Investment (GFCI)?
faqs.answer: GFCI means the investment made in building, plant and machinery, utilities, tools and equipment, and other assets required for manufacturing the end product.

faqs.question: Are secondhand machineries eligible for the benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only new machineries shall be eligible for the benefits under the scheme.

faqs.question: If a manufacturing unit is eligible under more than one scheme then can it select the scheme which allows most benefits?
faqs.answer: Yes, the unit can select any one scheme to avail benefits if it comes under the eligibility of more than one scheme.

faqs.question: What capital expenditures are allowed to avail capital and interest subsidy in furniture manufacturing units?
faqs.answer: Gross Fixed Capital Investment in new machinery, building and new equipment are considered as allowable.

faqs.question: What are dedicated industrial parks?
faqs.answer: Dedicated industrial parks are mentioned in food processing incentives where an additional 10% will be accorded to food processing units.

faqs.question: What period does enterprise have to remain in production if the subsidy is availed?
faqs.answer: Enterprise will have to remain in production for 5 years from the date of commercial production.

faqs.question: What conditions must an enterprise meet regarding the duration of production to avoid repayment of the capital investment subsidy?
faqs.answer: Enterprise will have to remain in production for 5 years from the date of commercial production.

faqs.question: What is the deadline for an enterprise to submit the application for Capital Subsidy through the online portal?
faqs.answer: The enterprise shall have to submit the application within one year from the date of the first disbursement of loan.

faqs.question: Which types of financial institutions loans are eligible for incentives under the Scheme according to RBI guidelines?
faqs.answer: Loan sanctioned and disbursed by Bank or Financial institution as per RBI guidelines will be eligible.

faqs.question: Which enterprises are eligible for diversification or expansion activities?
faqs.answer: Existing or New Enterprise carrying out an activity of Diversification or Expansion with an investment more than 50% of GFCI will be eligible.
